poem:
**Borderline**

In the thin margins of maps,  
where fences translate into shadows,  
a woman, unnamed,  
folded herself into silence.  
Her visa whispered expire,  
and the desert carried the echo  
of her departure.  
A silent leap,  
a line crossed,  
invisible ink spread  
across endless pages.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Chinese woman detained by US border patrol in Arizona dies by suicide A woman being detained in Arizona by US border patrol for overstaying her visa has died by suicide, according to Democratic congresswoman Pramila Jayapal. The woman, a 52-year-old Chinese national, had first been picked up in California after it had been determined that she had overstayed her B1/B2 visitor visa, Jayapal said in a statement. She was later sent to the Yuma station". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
